title: Verify dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_TIME is used in Upcoming Events
custom_steps:
When the user views the Upcoming Events module and the dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_TIME is modified to one of the following:
a) blank
b) "db"
c) any text string e.g. "Gates open at 7 PM"
custom_expected:
Then the user will see
a) nothing in the space where time usually is displayed
b) the time provided in the event response under "dateTime"
c) the exact text string entered e.g. "Gates open at 7 PM"

title: Verify dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_TIME is used in Upcoming Events > Event Detail
custom_steps:
When the user views the Upcoming Events > Event Detail (by tapping on the upcoming event in the events module) and the dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_TIME is modified to one of the following:
a) blank
b) "db"
c) any text string e.g. "Gates open at 7 PM"
custom_expected:
Then the user will see in the matchup area:
a) nothing in the space where time usually is displayed
b) the time provided in the event response under "dateTime"
c) the exact text string entered e.g. "Gates open at 7 PM"

title: Verify dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_TIME is used in Native Schedule
custom_steps:
When the user views the Native Schedule list and the dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_TIME is modified to one of the following:
a) blank
b) "db"
c) any text string e.g. "Gates open at 7 PM"
custom_expected:
Then the user will see
a) nothing in the space where time usually is displayed
b) the time provided in the event response under "dateTime"
c) the exact text string entered e.g. "Gates open at 7 PM"

title: Verify dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_TIME is used in Native Schedule > Schedule Event Detail
custom_steps:
When the user views the Native Schedule Event Details (by tapping on one of the rows in the Native Schedule) module and the dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_TIME is modified to one of the following:
a) blank
b) "db"
c) any text string e.g. "Gates open at 7 PM"

*Note tapping on a row for an event where there are no offers or promotions will go directly into a ticket purchase, to test this the event will need at least one offer or promotion
custom_expected:
Then the user will see
a) nothing in the space where time usually is displayed
b) the time provided in the event response under "dateTime"
c) the exact text string entered e.g. "Gates open at 7 PM"

custom_steps:
When the user views the Upcoming Events module and the dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_DATE is modified to one of the following:

custom_expected:

a) blank
b) "db"

title: Verify dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_VENUE is used in Upcoming Events
custom_steps:
When the user views the Upcoming Events module and the dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_VENUE is modified to one of the following:
a) blank
b) "db"
c) any text string e.g. "Downtown Convention Center"
custom_expected:
Then the user will see
a) nothing in the space where venue name usually is displayed
b) the venue provided in the event response under "venueName"
c) the exact text string entered e.g. "Downtown Convention Center"

title: Verify dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_VENUE is used in Upcoming Events > Event Detail
custom_steps:
When the user views the Event Detail (by tapping on the Upcoming Events module) and the dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_VENUE is modified to one of the following:
a) blank
b) "db"
c) any text string e.g. "Downtown Convention Center"

Then the user will see in the matchup area
a) nothing in the space where venue name usually is displayed
b) the venue provided in the event response under "venueName"

title: Verify dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_VENUE is NOT used in Native Schedule
custom_steps: When the user views the Native Schedule and looks for the venue name
custom_expected: Venue name is not displayed on the Native Schedule rows

title: Verify dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_VENUE is used in Native Schedule > Schedule Event Detail
custom_steps:
When the user views the Native Schedule Event Detail (by tapping on a row in the Native Schedule that has at least one offer or promotion) and the dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_VENUE is modified to one of the following:
a) blank
b) "db"
c) any text string e.g. "Downtown Convention Center"
custom_expected:
Then the user will see in the matchup area
a) nothing in the space where venue name usually is displayed
b) the venue provided in the event response under "venueName"
c) the exact text string entered e.g. "Downtown Convention Center"

title: Verify dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_TIME is used in Next Event
custom_steps:
When the user views the Next Event matchup area and the dynamic attribute for BALLPARK_TIME is modified to one of the following:
a) blank
b) "db"
c) any text string e.g. "Gates open at 7 PM"
custom_expected:
Then the user will see
a) nothing in the space where time usually is displayed (and the separator dot will be removed as well)
b) the time provided in the event response under "dateTime"
c) the exact text string entered e.g. "Gates open at 7 PM"

Then the user will see
a) nothing in the space where time usually is displayed
b) the time provided in the event response under "dateTime"
c) the exact text string entered e.g. "Gates open at 7 PM"

custom_expected:
Then the user will see in the matchup area
a) nothing in the space where time usually is displayed
b) the time provided in the event response under "dateTime"
c) the exact text string entered e.g. "Gates open at 7 PM"
